alert.note: Alert for Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 4:28PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern St. Tammany Parish in southeastern Louisiana and southwestern Hancock Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 428 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pearl River, or 9 miles north of Slidell, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Pearl River, Pearlington, Lacombe and Slidell Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 263 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 12 between mile markers 76 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany
